005package edu.wpi.first.math.controller;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.Num;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N1;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.system.Discretization;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.system.LinearSystem;
012import org.ejml.simple.SimpleMatrix;
013
014/**
015 * Contains the controller coefficients and logic for an implicit model follower.
016 *
017 * <p>Implicit model following lets us design a feedback controller that erases the dynamics of our
018 * system and makes it behave like some other system. This can be used to make a drivetrain more
019 * controllable during teleop driving by making it behave like a slower or more benign drivetrain.
020 *
021 * <p>For more on the underlying math, read appendix B.3 in
022 * https://file.tavsys.net/control/controls-engineering-in-frc.pdf.
023 */
024@SuppressWarnings("ClassTypeParameterName")
025public class ImplicitModelFollower<States extends Num, Inputs extends Num, Outputs extends Num> {
026  // Computed controller output
027  @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
028  private Matrix<Inputs, N1> m_u;
029
030  // State space conversion gain
031  @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
032  private Matrix<Inputs, States> m_A;
033
034  // Input space conversion gain
035  @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
036  private Matrix<Inputs, Inputs> m_B;
037
038  /**
039   * Constructs a controller with the given coefficients and plant.
040   *
041   * @param plant The plant being controlled.
042   * @param plantRef The plant whose dynamics should be followed.
043   * @param dtSeconds Discretization timestep.
044   */
045  public ImplicitModelFollower(
046      LinearSystem<States, Inputs, Outputs> plant,
047      LinearSystem<States, Inputs, Outputs> plantRef,
048      double dtSeconds) {
049    this(plant.getA(), plant.getB(), plantRef.getA(), plantRef.getB(), dtSeconds);
050  }
051
052  /**
053   * Constructs a controller with the given coefficients and plant.
054   *
055   * @param A Continuous system matrix of the plant being controlled.
056   * @param B Continuous input matrix of the plant being controlled.
057   * @param Aref Continuous system matrix whose dynamics should be followed.
058   * @param Bref Continuous input matrix whose dynamics should be followed.
059   * @param dtSeconds Discretization timestep.
060   */
061  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
062  public ImplicitModelFollower(
063      Matrix<States, States> A,
064      Matrix<States, Inputs> B,
065      Matrix<States, States> Aref,
066      Matrix<States, Inputs> Bref,
067      double dtSeconds) {
068    m_u = new Matrix<>(new SimpleMatrix(B.getNumCols(), 1));
069
070    // Discretize real dynamics
071    var discABPair = Discretization.discretizeAB(A, B, dtSeconds);
072    var discA = discABPair.getFirst();
073    var discB = discABPair.getSecond();
074
075    // Discretize desired dynamics
076    var discABrefPair = Discretization.discretizeAB(Aref, Bref, dtSeconds);
077    var discAref = discABrefPair.getFirst();
078    var discBref = discABrefPair.getSecond();
079
080    // Find u_imf that makes real model match reference model.
081    //
082    // x_k+1 = Ax_k + Bu_imf
083    // z_k+1 = Aref z_k + Bref u_k
084    //
085    // Let x_k = z_k.
086    //
087    // x_k+1 = z_k+1
088    // Ax_k + Bu_imf = Aref x_k + Bref u_k
089    // Bu_imf = Aref x_k - Ax_k + Bref u_k
090    // Bu_imf = (Aref - A)x_k + Bref u_k
091    // u_imf = B^+ ((Aref - A)x_k + Bref u_k)
092    // u_imf = -B^+ (A - Aref)x_k + B^+ Bref u_k
093
094    // The first term makes the open-loop poles that of the reference
095    // system, and the second term makes the input behave like that of the
096    // reference system.
097    m_A = discB.solve(discA.minus(discAref)).times(-1.0);
098    m_B = discB.solve(discBref);
099
100    reset();
101  }
102
103  /**
104   * Returns the control input vector u.
105   *
106   * @return The control input.
107   */
108  public Matrix<Inputs, N1> getU() {
109    return m_u;
110  }
111
112  /**
113   * Returns an element of the control input vector u.
114   *
115   * @param i Row of u.
116   * @return The row of the control input vector.
117   */
118  public double getU(int i) {
119    return m_u.get(i, 0);
120  }
121
122  /** Resets the controller. */
123  public void reset() {
124    m_u.fill(0.0);
125  }
126
127  /**
128   * Returns the next output of the controller.
129   *
130   * @param x The current state x.
131   * @param u The current input for the original model.
132   * @return The next controller output.
133   */
134  public Matrix<Inputs, N1> calculate(Matrix<States, N1> x, Matrix<Inputs, N1> u) {
135    m_u = m_A.times(x).plus(m_B.times(u));
136    return m_u;
137  }
138}
